marketNews.title: APBN Deficit IDR 21 Trillion as of End of May 2025
marketNews.content: Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, said on Tuesday (17/6) that the State Budget (APBN) recorded a deficit of 21 trillion rupiah or 0.09% of GDP during 5M25 (compared to a surplus of 4.3 trillion rupiah in 4M25), with a primary balance surplus of 192.1 trillion rupiah. State revenues during 5M25 reached 995.3 trillion rupiah (-11.4% YoY) or equivalent to 33.1% of the 2025 target. Meanwhile, state expenditures reached 1,016.3 trillion rupiah (-11.3% YoY) during 5M25 or equivalent to 28.1% of the 2025 target.

marketNews.title: Pelaku Industri Minta Pemerintah Moratorium Kenaikan Cukai Hasil Tembakau
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that tobacco industry players - ranging from farmers, business actors, to workers - requested that the government implement a moratorium on the increase of Excise Duty on Tobacco Products (CHT) for the next 3 years. The Chairman of the Federation of Tobacco, Food and Beverage, and All Indonesian Workers Union (FSP-RTMM SPSI), Sudarto, said that delaying the excise increase is a realistic step to protect labor-intensive sectors like the tobacco industry. Meanwhile, the National Coordinator of the Nusantara Tobacco Farmers and Workers Association (APPTN), Samukrah, stated that the moratorium is crucial to maintain the sustainability of farmers as part of the industry ecosystem.

marketNews.title: US and UK Agree on Trade Deal Terms to Cut Tariffs and Adjust Agricultural Quotas
marketNews.content: The US and UK governments agreed on the terms and conditions of the trade deal previously announced in May 2025 to cut US tariffs on UK exports and increase UK quotas for US agricultural products. This agreement includes the elimination of basic import tariffs of 10% for the UK civil aircraft sector. Furthermore, UK automotive exports received a reduction in import tariffs from 27.5% to 10% in June 2025, with an annual quota limit of 100,000 units. The US will also exempt the UK from the 25% steel tariff up to certain, yet undetermined, quota limits. Meanwhile, the UK committed to meeting US requirements regarding the certainty of steel and aluminum supply, including issues related to the ownership of related steel mills.

marketNews.title: Director General of Customs and Excise: Sweetened Beverage Excise Tax Policy Will Not Be Implemented This Year
marketNews.content: Director General of Customs and Excise, Djaka Budi Utama, stated on Tuesday (17/6) that the excise duty policy for packaged sweetened beverages (MBDK) will not be implemented this year. Djaka did not elaborate on the reason behind the delay but conveyed that all policies, including MBDK excise, will always consider economic conditions. Previously, in early 2025, the Director of Communication and User Guidance for Customs Services, Nirwala Dwi Heryanto, stated that the MBDK excise tax was planned to be implemented in 2H25.

marketNews.title: Economists Consensus Predicts Bank Indonesia to Hold BI Rate Steady
marketNews.content: Economists' consensus predicts Bank Indonesia will keep the BI Rate steady at 5.5% in the Board of Governors Meeting announcement on Wednesday (18/6), according to a survey compiled by Reuters. Economists' consensus forecasts that the BI Rate will fall by 25-50 bps by the end of 3Q25.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway on Danantara's Investment Focus
marketNews.content: We view this Danantara investment plan as in line with the body's investment focus on 8 sectors, including mineral downstreaming. For TPIA itself, the involvement of Danantara and INA in the CA-EDC project will be capital support for the project, thereby providing room for TPIA for other business developments.

tickerNews.title: Danantara & INA Plan to Become Investors in CA-EDC Plant for TPIA
tickerNews.content: BPI Danantara and the Indonesia Investment Authority (INA) stated on Tuesday (17/6) that they have signed a memorandum of understanding worth 800 million US dollars with Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA$). Under this memorandum of understanding, Danantara and INA will explore the possibility of entering as new investors in the chlor-alkali and ethylene dichloride (CA-EDC) plant project. The plant - which will be managed by TPIA's subsidiary named PT Chandra Asri Alkali - is targeted to have a production capacity of 400,000 metric tons of caustic soda (sodium hydroxide) and 500,000 metric tons of ethylene dichloride annually. TPIA Director, Edi Rivai, mentioned that his party is allocating capex of 8.8 trillion rupiah during 2025 focused on the construction of the CA-EDC plant. The plant has entered the construction planning stage, with PT Chandra Asri Alkali having already signed a 3-year salt offtake agreement with BCI Minerals Limited for the plant's raw materials. Previously, TPIA and INA signed an MoU in 2023, allowing INA and potential foreign investors to explore plans to purchase shares in PT Chandra Asri Alkali. Furthermore, PT Chandra Asri Alkali also signed a letter of intent with PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (Inalum), covering the potential supply of wet caustic soda by PT Chandra Asri Alkali to Inalum with a volume of up to 120,000 metric tons per year and the potential for Inalum's equity participation in PT Chandra Asri Alkali up to 10%. In a separate transaction, Aster Chemicals and Energy - a joint venture between TPIA and Glencore - announced it has signed an agreement to acquire full ownership of the condensate splitter facility and related assets owned by PCS Pte. Ltd. in Jurong Island, Singapore. The value of the planned transaction has not been announced. Aster also plans to revitalize the facility, increasing Aster's total oil processing capacity from 237,000 barrels per day to more than 300,000 barrels per day. Previously, Aster Chemicals and Energy had announced the planned acquisition of Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals, which currently operates a polyethylene facility with a capacity of 400,000 tons per year in Jurong Island.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Realizes Buyback of 32.2 Billion Shares Worth IDR 2.1 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia announced that it has realized a buyback of approximately 32.2 billion shares with a total purchase value of approximately 130.8 million US dollars or approximately 2.1 trillion rupiah by the end of the corporate action implementation period on June 11, 2025. This realization is equivalent to ~65% of the total buyback fund allocation of 200 million US dollars, implying an average purchase price of ~65 rupiah per share. The shares resulting from the buyback are planned to be allocated as an ESOP/MSOP program. GOTO is planning another share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 200 million US dollars or 3.3 trillion rupiah from June 19, 2025, to June 18, 2026, where this plan will be discussed at the GMS on June 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Shareholders Approve Final Dividend for 2024 Book Year
tickerNews.content: $KKGI: Resource Alam Indonesia shareholders approved the plan for a final dividend distribution for the 2024 book year of 15 rupiah per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 3.8% as of Tuesday (17/6). Previously, KKGI also distributed an interim dividend of 15 rupiah per share in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Revises 2025 New Store Opening Target Down to 800 Outlets
tickerNews.content: $AMRT: Corporate Secretary of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya, Solihin, said that his party revised the target for new store openings during 2025 from the initial plan of 1,000 stores to 800 stores (vs. 2024 realization: 1,033 new stores). This step was taken following changes in the management's outlook on the development of the retail industry in 2025.

tickerNews.title: CTRA Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Distribution
tickerNews.content: $CTRA: Ciputra Development shareholders approved the plan for a dividend distribution for the 2024 book year of 444.85 billion rupiah or 24 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a ~21% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 21%) and indicates a dividend yield of 2.4% as of Tuesday (17/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is June 25, 2025, while dividend payment is on July 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Declined in May 2025, Market Share Increased Slightly
tickerNews.content: $INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a decrease in cement sales volume of -4% YoY in May 2025, but market share increased to 29.5% (vs. May 2024: 29.3%, April 2025: 28.2%) due to a deeper decline in industry-wide cement sales (-4.6% YoY). In terms of segmentation, packaged cement (bag) sales and bulk sales decreased by -1.3% YoY and -10% YoY, respectively, in May 2025. INTP management explained that there has been no significant increase in infrastructure projects in the Java region and the Nation's Capital (IKN) yet. Over 5M25, INTP sales volume decreased by -2.1% YoY (5M24: +10% YoY), in line with industry-wide sales which also decreased by -2.1% YoY (vs. 5M24: +2.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BUMI Shareholder Chengdong Investment Corporation Sold ~2.53 Million Shares Since December 2024
tickerNews.content: $BUMI: Bumi Resources shareholder, Chengdong Investment Corporation, sold approximately 2.53 million BUMI shares with an average price of 122 rupiah per share from December 2024 until June 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 308 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Chengdong Investment Corporation's ownership in BUMI decreased from 10.68% to 9.99%.

tickerNews.title: CTBN to Distribute Large 2024 Dividend with High Payout Ratio
tickerNews.content: $CTBN: Citra Tubindo will distribute a dividend for the 2024 book year amounting to approximately 424.2 billion rupiah or 530 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a ~99% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 0%) based on the rupiah to US dollar exchange rate at the 16,300 level, and indicates a dividend yield of 7.5% as of Tuesday (17/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is June 19, 2025, while payment is on July 15, 2025.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Recorded New Contract Value Down 62% YoY in 5M25
tickerNews.content: $WIKA: Wijaya Karya Corporate Secretary, Ngatemin, said that his party recorded a new contract value of 3.37 trillion rupiah during 5M25, a decrease of -62% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DKFT to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Book Year
tickerNews.content: $DKFT: Central Omega Resources will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 book year amounting to approximately 55.1 billion rupiah or 10 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to 40% of DKFT's 1Q25 net profit and indicates a dividend yield of 2.1% as of Tuesday (17/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is June 25, 2025, while payment is on July 7, 2025.

tickerNews.title: DATA Secured Working Capital Facility from Bank Mandiri (BMRI)
tickerNews.content: Remala Abadi ($DATA) signed a working capital credit facility of up to 220 billion rupiah from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI). This facility has a maturity tenor of 12 months.

tickerNews.title: NFCX Plans Private Placement with Dilution of 9.09% to Fund Development
tickerNews.content: NFC Indonesia ($NFCX) plans to conduct a private placement of up to approximately 66.7 million new shares with a dilution effect of 9.09%. The exercise price and prospective investors have not been announced. The funds raised are intended for investment to support the company's development. This plan will be discussed at the EGMS on June 18, 2025.
